Column Comment.0: RESERVES ENTITY IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for a reserves entity. A reservesentity may be comprised of a single business object (such as a well) or a group ofbusiness objects (such as all the completions producing from a pool).
Column Comment.1: RESERVE CLASS IDENTIFIER: The reserve classed for identifying the confidencelevel and producing status of the reserve volumes.
Column Comment.2: REFERENCE PRODUCT TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of product(fluid) such as GAS, OIL, WATER, NGL, etc. Includes the less comm on products likeSTEAM, METHANE, BUTANE, HELIUM, etc.
Column Comment.3: SUMMARY IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the reserves summary.
Column Comment.4: SUMMARY OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique number added to allow details for areserves summary to be captured. The column SUMMARY ID defines a summary -SUMMARY OBS NO is used to sequence detail rows within that summary.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: ANALYST BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the businessassociate who is the author of this revision summary.
Column Comment.7: APPROVED BY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for thebusiness associate who approved this revision to the reserve volumes.
Column Comment.8: APPROVED DATE: the date that the revision was approved.
Column Comment.9: CREATED DATE: the date that this revision summary was created.
Column Comment.10: CREATED DATE DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.11: CURRENT BALANCE: The remaining technical reserves volume as of the currentbalance date.
Column Comment.12: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.13: UNIT OF MEASURE: Unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.14: DECLINE CASE ID: Identifies the CASE_ID in the PDEN_DECLINE_CASE tableassociated with this reserves volume.
Column Comment.15: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.16: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.17: GROSS SUMMARY INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this row of datarepresents a gross volume summary.
Column Comment.18: INTEREST SET IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the interest set.
Column Comment.19: INTEREST SET PARTNER: Unique identifier for the business associate who is apartner in an interest set.
Column Comment.20: BA INTEREST SET SEQUENCE NUMBER: unique sequencing component to allowverioning of the interest set over time.
Column Comment.21: MATERIAL_BALANCE CASE ID: Identifies the CASE_ID in thePDEN_MATERIAL_BAL table associated with this reserves volume.
Column Comment.22: NET SUMMARY INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that is row of data represents anet summary, associated with a partner. Use the FK fro BA INT SET PARTNER totrack the interest set type and the partner.
Column Comment.23: OPENING BALANCE: The initial reserves volume at the start of the current reservesevaluation period.
Column Comment.24: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.25: UNIT OF MEASURE: Unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.26: PARTNER OBSERVATION NUMBER: This column is used when a businessassociate holds more than one interest share of a specific interest type (working,production etc) in a partnership. This can happen as a result of corporate mergers orasset acquisitions. If a partner only holds one interest share, this number will alwaysbe 1. Please note that this column should not be used to track multiple interest types;in this event, a new interest set must be created.
Column Comment.27: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.28: PDEN PRODUCT TYPE: The PDEN_PRODUCT associated with this particularRESENT_PRODUCT. As an example, for the RESENT_PRODUCT HEAVY OIL thecorresponding PDEN_PRODUCT would be OIL.
Column Comment.29: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.30: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: the type of production entity may be equal to oneof the table names of the PDEN subtype tables, such as PDEN_WELL,PDEN_COUNTY or PDEN_FIELD. Validated by check constraint.
Column Comment.31: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.32: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.33: REPORT IND: A Y/N flag added to allow users to keep track of rows that should beincluded in reporting.
Column Comment.34: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.35: RESERVE ENTITY VOLUME METHOD: The method used by the analyst toestablish reserve volumes, such as decline analysis, material balance or volumetriccalculations.
Column Comment.36: VOLUME_ANALYSIS CASE ID: Identifies the CASE_ID in thePDEN_VOLUME_ANALYSIS table associated with this reserves volume.
Column Comment.37: YIELD PARENT PRODUCT: The parent product for this yeild.
Column Comment.38: YIELD RATE: The ratio between the current product and the parent product. The gasoil ratio (GOR) defines the yield rate at which solution gas is produced from oil.
Column Comment.39: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.40: UNIT OF MEASURE: Unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.41: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.42: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.43: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.44: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.45: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.46: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.47: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
